intro: Campanula willdenowii, commonly known as the Willdenow's bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems covered in fine, soft hairs. The plant produces bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to violet, blooming from June to August. Its leaves are lance-shaped and hairy, often with a slightly rough texture. Campanula willdenowii prefers well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges or meadows.
